content.question:
Hic Hecuba et natae nequiquam altaria circum,

praecipites atra ceu tempestate columbae,

condensae et divum amplexae simulacra sedebant.

Ipsum autem sumptis Priamum iuvenalibus armis

5ut vidit, "Quae mens tam dira, miserrime coniunx,

impulit his cingi telis? Aut quo ruis?" inquit.

"Non tali auxilio nec defensoribus istis

tempus eget; non, si ipse meus nunc adforet Hector."

Aeneid 2. 275-282

Answer the following questions in English unless the question specifically asks you to write out Latin words. Number your answer to each question.

1. Which two Latin words in this passage are compared to columbae (line 2) ?

2. In lines 1-3 (Hic . . . sedebant), (A) which two Latin words suggest that Hecuba and her family are in danger? (B) Translate them in context.

3. (A) Identify one and only one literary device found in line 5 (ut . . . coniunx) and (B) write out the Latin word or words that illustrate it.

4. In lines 1-6 (Hic . . . telis), (A) identify the two neuter plural nouns and (B) identify their case.

5. (A) Identify the grammatical construction of sumptis iuvenalibus armis (line 4) and (B) translate it in context.

6. In this passage, which three Latin words indicate that Hecuba doesn’t understand what Priam is thinking?

7. Later in Book 2, Aeneas unexpectedly sees his own wife. Briefly describe what she tells Aeneas. Answer in 1-2 complete sentences.
